passage_text: German Meaning: The name Joss is a German baby name. In German the meaning of the name Joss is: One of the Goths'. Joss Name Meaning. The meaning of Joss has more than one different etymologies. It has same or different meanings in other countries and languages. The different meanings of the name Joss are: 1  Hebrew meaning: God is salvation. 2  Latin meaning: The merry one From the name Jocelin Also used as an independent name. 3  Spanish meaning: Derivative: Form of Joshua

This interesting surname is of Norman-French origins, and derives from an Old French personal name Gosse, itself a shortened nickname form of Gocelin. The true origination is probably the Germanic Gozzo, of the pre 7th Century, itself a personal name derived from got meaning god, or more likely good.

Joss is used predominantly in the English language, and its origin is Old French, Hebrew, and Breton. Joss is a diminutive form of the name Jocelyn (English). Joss is also a variant (English) of the name Joseph (English, French, and German). Joss is also a variant of the name Joshua (English). Joss is also a variant of the name Joyce (English). Joss is not regularly used as a baby name for boys. It is not listed in the top 1000 names. In 2012, out of the group of boy names directly linked to Joss, Joshua was the most commonly used.

Joss /joss/ [1 syll.] as a boys' name (also used as girls' name Joss) is of Old German origin, and the meaning of Joss is a member of the Germanic tribe, the Gauts. English name that is a nickname of Jocelyn, which used to be a masculine name. Also possibly a variant of Joseph. Actor Joss Ackland.
